citation.article-title: Phycicola gilvus gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from living seaweed.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Phycicola gilvus sp. nov.
Phycicola gilvus (gil′vus. L. masc. adj. gilvus pale yellow-coloured).
Has the following characteristics in addition to those given for the genus above.
Young cultures contain rod-shaped cells (0.40–0.50×0.80–1.20 μm), whereas older cultures contain coccoid cells (0.18–0.33 μm in diameter).
Rods are motile by means of flagella, but coccoid cells are non-motile.
Colonies are circular, smooth, entire and reach 1–2 mm in diameter after 5 days incubation on TSA.
Colony colour is variable depending on culture conditions; colonies are white when cells are incubated in the dark, but yellow when incubated in the light.
Oxidase-negative.
The temperature range for growth is 4–30 °C, with optimum growth at 25 °C.
No growth occurs at ≥37 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 6.1–10.1, with optimum growth at pH 7.1–8.1.
Growth occurs in the presence of 2 % NaCl but not with 3 % NaCl.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Unable to utilize citrate.
Voges–Proskauer test is weakly positive.
Negative for arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase.
Hydrolyses aesculin but not casein, elastin, starch, gelatin or urea.
Decomposition of hypoxanthine, dl-tyrosine and xanthine does not occur.
Acid is produced from l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextran, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, maltose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin and sucrose.
Acid production from d-arabinose and d-xylose is weak.

Acid is not produced from the following carbon and energy sources: adonitol, 2,3-butanediol, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, d-fructose, myo-inositol, inulin, d-lactose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, 1,2-propanediol, raffinose, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, trehalose or d-xylitol.
In tests with the API ZYM system, positive for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI phosphohydrolase, acid phosphatase and α-glucosidase.
Weakly positive for esterase lipase (C8), trypsin, β-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

The following enzyme activities give negative responses: esterase (C4), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (49.7 %) and anteiso-C17 : 0 (27.3 %).
The G+C content of the DNA is 69.8 mol%.
The type strain, SSWW-21T (=KCTC 19185T =DSM 18319T), was isolated from a living seaweed sample collected on the coast of Jeju, Republic of Korea.
